C3.value: You don't know me, but, how do you feel about the local chicken policy?

C4.value: No. But do you care about local politics, or are you just one of those national voters?

C5.value: Are you smart enough to understand that free trade agreements harm YOU the most?

C6.value: Chickens should be free. They're people too! I am a member of CETA and I'll dance naked in your lawn until you get rid of all of them!

C7.value: Oh, I wasn't aware of such a restriction. I'll check in with town hall.

C8.value: Do you know where town hall is?

C11.value: Fine, but my throat feels itchy.

C12.value: Oh Mom, its not a big deal. I shouldn't have brought it up.

C13.value: Ok. I'll stop by and get some at the store. Wait, did you say "Town hall", why?

R0.value: Meherban my friend, God grant you tranquility!

R2.value: You know, i've been trying to add another chick back in the yard, but the chicken inspector-wala keeps taking them! He's got them all locked up in the slammer! And I've got fines on my fines.  Does that seem fair?

R3.value: Bhagjaa! I've got somewhere to be.

R5.value: If you walk around town a bit, you will see a building with the sign "Town Hall" right in front of it. Are you even from around here?

R6.value: I don't have time for this, leave me alone.

R8.value: Oh no. Did you take something for it? I have ciderberry tincture and some lemons. I can mix that and it'll flush that tickle right out. Miss Sarah send me the recipe just a few days ago, she said it fixed her cousin's friend's landlord's mother right up.

R9.value: Oh, I forgot, actually I think we used the last cinderberry. Pick some up on your way to Town Hall. Also, get some garlic loaves and pickled corn peppers.

R10.value: I want you to look into selling these new electrophones I've been hearing about. What do you need, a permission slip? No go!
